org.deeplearning4j.clustering.lsh

Interface LSH

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    RandomProjectionLSH

    public interface LSH
    This interface gathers the minimal elements for an LSH implementation See chapter 3 of : _Mining Massive Datasets_, Anand Rajaraman and Jeffrey Ullman http://www.mmds.org/

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      INDArray bucket(INDArray query)
      Returns the set of all vectors that could approximately be considered negihbors of the query, without selection on the basis of distance or number of neighbors.
      java.lang.String getDistanceMeasure()
      Returns an instance of the distance measure associated to the LSH family of this implementation.
      int getHashLength()
      Returns the size of a hash compared against in one hashing bucket, corresponding to an AND construction denoting hashLength by h, amplifies a (d1, d2, p1, p2) hash family into a (d1, d2, p1^h, p2^h)-sensitive one (match probability is decreasing with h)
      int getInDimension() 
      int getNumTables()
      denoting numTables by n, amplifies a (d1, d2, p1, p2) hash family into a (d1, d2, (1-p1^n), (1-p2^n))-sensitive one (match probability is increasing with n)
      void makeIndex(INDArray data)
      Populates the index with data vectors.
      INDArray search(INDArray query, double maxRange)
      Returns the approximate neighbors within a distance bound.
      INDArray search(INDArray query, int k)
      Returns the approximate neighbors within a k-closest bound

    • Method Detail

      • getDistanceMeasure

        java.lang.String getDistanceMeasure()
        Returns an instance of the distance measure associated to the LSH family of this implementation. Beware, hashing families and their amplification constructs are distance-specific.

      • getHashLength

        int getHashLength()
        Returns the size of a hash compared against in one hashing bucket, corresponding to an AND construction denoting hashLength by h, amplifies a (d1, d2, p1, p2) hash family into a (d1, d2, p1^h, p2^h)-sensitive one (match probability is decreasing with h)
        Returns:
        the length of the hash in the AND construction used by this index

      • getNumTables

        int getNumTables()
        denoting numTables by n, amplifies a (d1, d2, p1, p2) hash family into a (d1, d2, (1-p1^n), (1-p2^n))-sensitive one (match probability is increasing with n)
        Returns:
        the # of hash tables in the OR construction used by this index

      • getInDimension

        int getInDimension()
        Returns:
        The dimension of the index vectors and queries

      • makeIndex

        void makeIndex(INDArray data)
        Populates the index with data vectors.
        Parameters:
        data - the vectors to index

      • bucket

        INDArray bucket(INDArray query)
        Returns the set of all vectors that could approximately be considered negihbors of the query, without selection on the basis of distance or number of neighbors.
        Parameters:
        query - a vector to find neighbors for
        Returns:
        its approximate neighbors, unfiltered

      • search

        INDArray search(INDArray query,
                double maxRange)
        Returns the approximate neighbors within a distance bound.
        Parameters:
        query - a vector to find neighbors for
        maxRange - the maximum distance between results and the query
        Returns:
        approximate neighbors within the distance bounds

      • search

        INDArray search(INDArray query,
                int k)
        Returns the approximate neighbors within a k-closest bound
        Parameters:
        query - a vector to find neighbors for
        k - the maximum number of closest neighbors to return
        Returns:
        at most k neighbors of the query, ordered by increasing distance
